website_summaries.verdict: A solid all-purpose cycling bag to choose when you have large items like laptops to carry around.
pros: Slim, aerodynamic profile hides two primary interior pockets for large items like laptops and tablets
The fasteners provide a secure mount around the body while riding at fast speeds
cons: The fasteners may require some adjusting to get the fit right around the arms and shoulders

customer_reviews.title: Great front pocket with lots of compartments
customer_reviews.text: I'm addicted to this thing. I can wear it ANYWHERE - back home on day hikes or trail runs in the West, and all around my current home, NYC. It fits two full Nalgene bottles in the side pockets, and to combat the water bottle falling out problem folks talked about, I just clip the bottles into the side clips through the loops on the lids. This backback fits my 13 inch Macbook Pro, a book, and a light jacket with no problem. It's small, but packs more than I expected! Great front pocket with lots of compartments. My husband and I each have one, and we love them!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, small COMFORTABLE backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Great small bag. Well made and perhaps most importantly, it's incredibly comfortable. I use it while mountainbiking and it's perfect. Super light weight, great shoulder straps and it will absolutely stay put, especially if you use the chest and waist strap (I don't use the waist strap). I can't imagine a much better small backpack.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, quality, perfect day hike backpack
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light weight day hike backpack and read so many reviews before purchasing this one. And I must say I am in love. It is perfect. The seams are very well made. No extra threads on them. It’s also very roomy. We pack two large thermos in it and a blanket along with some snacks. Love that it buckles at waistline, giving it a nice balance when hiking on longer trails. Had this for a year and went on many hikes. So far so good, no wear, no tear. Can’t wait to try their overnight packs and purchase a second day backpack for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Olena B

customer_reviews.title: High quality day pack
customer_reviews.text: I love this compact Osprey backpack. It is the perfect size for an afternoon hike with enough room for a rain jacket, water bottles and a few snacks. The straps are super comfortable both with and without a shirt and I've found that even on hot days the pack is comfortable. When you first start using this bag, you can tell how well made it is. I haven't had it long enough to really comment on its long-term durability, but initial quality is through-the-roof. The only thing I wish is that the side water bottle compartments secured bottles a bit better. I was climbing with this pack on recently and lost a water bottle down the side of a cliff.
customer_reviews.author: GetOutside2121

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt fit a 6'2 man
customer_reviews.text: im 6'2 200 lbs. this pack didnt fint my frame at all. even for a day park. the sternum strap up around my throat when i had the shoulder straps adjusted to a comfortable position. bag did seem well constructed and would probably have been a nice day bag to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Too small and mesh water holder not deep enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use as a carry on and hiking day pack for travel. But I will need to return because it’s too small. The water holder pocket is not deep enough, so that water keeps falling out. Need to find a box. It’s not one of the items Amazon takes back without a box unfortunately. Not a great price either. Same as at REI. I was disappointed. I normally love this brand
customer_reviews.author: BRIG C.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BAG
customer_reviews.text: 5' 4". The bag is a little long on me but after adjusting the straps properly hip straps then shoulder then chest the handle doesn't dig into my neck much. All the compartments are great to have (keys and wallet secure in the small zip, first aid, dog treats in the inner pocket, rain jacket, water bottle, and cap in large compartment). I use it as a day hike bag since it can store water for me and the pup and my every day commuter bag since it's so handy.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy T.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for short people
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Osprey pack I've had this problem with, the handle on the back sits too high up, actually goes onto the back of my neck. It presses into my neck in such a way that I am unable to keep my head straight. Instead, I need to look slightly down. No matter how I adjust it, I can't get it to fit better. The same exact thing happened with the Osprey Poco child carrier, so I think Osprey is just not great for people my size. For reference, I'm only 5'1 and have a short torso. Anyone else who has this issue might want to try Kelty or Deuter, those two seem to fit me much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: smaller than i imagined, nice when you need minimal, but perhaps too minimal
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of osprey packs and accessories, really like their brand as they seem to put a lot of thought into ergonomics and function. However, the daylight is just very small and limiting. I also purchased a daylight plus, and that's about as small as I would go for most occasions. This might be better for a kid or teen that doesn't need much for a short hike. The construction is very good like other osprey products, I just found it too small for most uses, but I use the daylight plus model quite a bit when I need a more compact option.
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Update-I've had this for about a month or two and a plastic clip on it broke! The pack wasn't overly full and didn't have anything wildly heavy. I would have done better to get a cheap backpack at Wal-Mart! Pros-lightweight, venting keeps it from getting too hot. Cons-not a very good shape for carrying stuff. My old Petzl bug backpack fits a lot more and is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Anna E.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite travel pack
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite backpacks for several reasons: - It's lightweight - The straps are breathable - It's stylish - There's more storage space than you think - The material is very high quality I use this pack mainly for work to carry various things. It fits a MacBook Air with no issue, along with my lunch and a light jacket when needed. For a bag this size, you wouldn't think it would hold that much...but it's up for the task. I haven't hiked with it yet, but I'm certain that this will be my go-to bag when I hit the trails. I highly recommend this bag for the comfort, quality, and generous storage space for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Danger

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself is okay. It fits nicely, and is spacious, even with a bladder (not included) But I ordered the BLACK pack. And this pack is most definitely not black, And it feels cheaply made. Definitely would not recommend for anything intense. It is built for more casual activities. But if you are anything like me, And beat the sh*t out of you Ruck, this isn't the bag for you. I just feel like I could have bought a 20 dollar Walmart bag, and would get the same manufacturing outcome. Waste of money. Stick with camelbak.
customer_reviews.author: Steven McKernan

customer_reviews.title: That handle at the top...
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as some other reviewers - the handle on the top of the pack is in the way. No matter how I adjust the straps, it just does not fit my body. Either the handle on the top digs into the back of my neck, or the bottom of the pack is too low on my butt. I am 5'4" and thought maybe I might have a long enough torso for this to fit, but there is NO way this is going to work for me. Sad, because the amulet purple color is beautiful and I love Osprey packs. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: vtpaca

customer_reviews.title: Lives Up To Standards
customer_reviews.text: I personally really like osprey, and this bag does not fully disappoint. I have some complaints though. The waist strap is roughly 1” wide and uncomfortable for me with just a thin T-shirt on but I do tend to like any waist straps tighter than most. For not having a frame, this bag does not pack well as I had basically folded it in a suitcase and upon arrival it stayed in a similar shape until the end of my next use. Note: this bag is small, make sure to check volume if unaware (2L hydration pack full, xl packable synthetic jacket, tuning screwdriver, mini first aid kit) I would give a 3.5 star if it were possible.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Regretting it unfortunately..
customer_reviews.text: Too small for any real daily use. I live in NYC and practically live out of my backpack. The “computer sleeve” is super thin and provides almost no protection for the computer. If you decide to put books in it... forget about putting anything else in the bad. The side mesh water bottle holders are completely useless. They are designed in a way that nothing.. I repeat, nothing will stay in. I do not recommend this bag unless you want a purse... even still, you are probably not going to get much use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Useless water bottle pockets
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Daylite, Daylite Plus, and Daylite Travel and they all have useless water bottle pockets. My water bottle fell out every time I set the packs down or bent over. I read about this in other people's reviews but thought, "This is Osprey, they can't really have made a pack (or 3) with useless water bottle pockets!" But they did. Even if I could have gotten over the useless water bottle pockets, I wouldn't have kept them. I wore them around town for a weekend, but they never felt comfortable because of the the way the straps connect at the top of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Wrld Trvlr

customer_reviews.title: Decent mid-size pack for your day travel needs
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this little pack. It's a very sturdy solid little commuter bag for me. I take it to work and pretty much everywhere I go. It's great for holding water phone wallet and sun gear and also my sunglasses. It's got a nice hardback which is helpful in keeping it structured and also the straps are great because they're practically see-through and don't cause too much sweat. It's pretty small but it's great for its size. Plenty of pockets in little areas where you can store things. I'm a medium tall person, about 5 foot 6 and I've heard shorter people say it doesn't work for them. It does work for me
customer_reviews.author: E. Laffan

customer_reviews.title: Needs a tightening strap over the mesh pockets
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. The ONLY downside is that my hydro flasks are constantly falling out of the side mesh pockets if I bend over slightly. Accidentally fell out one time and hit my cat in the face. Overall the chest straps are nice and it feels good in terms of weight distribution on my shoulders. I’m 5’4 about 145 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Maribeth Powers

customer_reviews.title: My go to pack!
customer_reviews.text: I used this pack on vacation. It held everything I needed with space to spare, even my digital 35 mil camera with detachable lens. Super light wtg yet strong, plus the way the back of pack is made, it's cooler to wear. When it arrived we were concerned how strong it would actually be due to how light wtg it is. It's very strong and the strap nicely cushioned. My husband called Osprey, they helped him narrow down our selection based on my need, could not have been more helpful. If you are looking for a super comfy pack, this is the one you need. Plus lots of color selections. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice SMALL backpack; waterbottle pockets are too small
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice backpack, albeit a small one which is not necessarily a bad thing! I like not being able to carry a ton of stuff around. The big issue for me is the water bottle pockets. They are just a little too small. And there's a strap on the side which is good for a very tall water bottle but medium size water bottles tend to pop out.
customer_reviews.author: abbycw

customer_reviews.title: Love the bag!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 5" male and bag fits me very well. Handle strap does not ride or rub my neck like others have complained of. Side pockets hold things very well but I don't think they were designed for water bottles. Bigger ones that have something you can put the compression strap through seem to work very well. Has plenty of room for clothes and all essential for a day hike or bike ride
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good Ski backpack
customer_reviews.text: I got it as a skiing backpack, it held up great for a full season. Room for a large enough water bladder to last you all day, the clasps stay nice and tight, the zippers don't catch. I had one particularly bad fall and slide but after I dusted off the snow it was as good as new, no harm from the fall at all. It's big enough that I could fit my helmet in the bottom part of the bag but it was a pretty snug fit. Not a large backpack but I wanted something small. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not to hike, or anything like it’s meant to be used for, but to carry my camera gear when bicycling. For that it is a champ. The back breathes nicely, and you can add a hydration bladder if wanted for longer rides. I have all my necessary gear in it in the pics, but before leaving my car I can take out anything I might not need/want, then cinch it smaller. The color is the oil blue something, and thankfully not as dark as the pics online looked.
customer_reviews.author: Erik T.

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly the same one as the photo shows, but good!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a very nice backpack, but I was disappointed that it does not appear like the picture indicates. I specifically purchased this from Amazon because the photo is of the newer version of this backpack. I received an older version (has a black patch with the Osprey older logo). Still, it does appear to be a good backpack. Update: I used this for a multi-week trip in Europe, and have used it for biking. It is really nice - lightweight, good storage. Sometimes, a tall water bottle will fall out of the side pocket. The durability is excellent, one year later!
customer_reviews.author: LMarie

customer_reviews.title: Super light, durable and tons of pockets
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag, got the stone grey and it’s perfect. Super light, seems durable and has tons of pockets and a red key clip inside. The price is great, mine was $34 and osprey bags run anywhere from $50-$150. I got this for a hiking trip in Norway, and this will be perfect to lay flat in my suitcase, it’s so light and does not take up a lot of room, yet when the bag is on me, there’s so much room for items! It’s a great size. Looks small but it’s not
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I went to connect the chest strap and it broke. I have to spend my money to ship in for repair and then wait another 6 to 8 weeks for a repair, according to their website. NEVER buy this.
customer_reviews.author: SemperFI

customer_reviews.title: Wow. What a backpack.  The best I ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to ride my bike. Somehow because of the design I do not feel pressure on my actual back. It breathes well and does not feel hot. It looks so good too. I use it when walking around town catching pokemon and always get compliments or questions as to the brand. I enjoy the attention, that is why I bough the yellow one. Zippers feel durable and the compartments are easily accessible. Impressed with my first Osprey product ever.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Pau

customer_reviews.title: perfect day pack for hikes
customer_reviews.text: This pack, while small, is made in the same quality way Osprey makes their bigger packs. It's big enough for any day hike you may take. You've got room for lunch, snacks, water, and shell and more. If you're in the city, you can slip in a book or iPad. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A very versatile pack
customer_reviews.text: Simple basic bag, good for daily use. I like the two outside mesh pockets for water bottles. Decent amount of space for traveling short distances. I really like the external hydration pocket so hydration pack is not with other items. Can be used in so many ways. I enjoy this pack and Osprey packs over all.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great for commuters
customer_reviews.text: I wear this backpack to ride my road bike to and from work. It easily carries a laptop and change of clothes. I am a women and can pack flats in the backpack with jeans and a blouse. That’s about all it can fit though. I would recommend buying the larger one if you need to fit more items. Other than that- no complaints. The meshing on the back is super breathable and helps to keep my back cool. No issues wearing it for extended periods or up hill. It won’t fit your helmet but you can definitely buckle it onto the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bag for day trips
customer_reviews.text: Received my Daylite backpack within a few days of ordering. This is a great bag for day trips. It's a bit smaller than expected but it's hard to tell when you order online. I'm thinking I should have ordered the Daylite Plus so I had a little more room. Not to take anything away from this bag, it serves it purpose as a great smaller backpack. Some people have complained about he drink pockets on the sides, I haven't had an issue with that. The straps above help hold them secure.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton R.

customer_reviews.title: incredibly versatile, well-made bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag held up very well during my recent travels to burning man, which requires a lot out of things. No rips, tears, or any sign of wear and tear after abusing it for two weeks. It has great compartmentalization while not being frustratingly inaccessible (in-pocket separators, clips, etc.), and was able to hold a 2L camelback, food for two for an entire day's adventure, as well as sunscreen, knives, and all of the other little things that you'd need on an adventure. Easily worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Small with great capability, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for short day hikes while on longer term hikes into wilderness areas. I mainly wanted something lightweight but could hold a water reservoir and a few snack/supplies. This fit the bill perfectly weighing in at 1lb so it didn't add much weight to my main pack to carry it in. It holds my 3L reservoir just fine and is comfortable to wear. Seems well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Sara

customer_reviews.title: Best daypack, look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my daypack! Great quality material, sturdy, roomy and vibrant color. Very comfortable to wear, great for light packing. I was impressed by how much i could fit in it, it’s small but i was able to pack it for a weekend trip. It has few pockets but this was not an issue for me. It has a compartment for a hydration bladder but i didn’t use it, i assume it would work great if you have a need for it. I would definitely recommend this brand. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Rider

customer_reviews.title: cannot recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.text: I have travelled with this bag for extended months and it has held up in quality this entire time! It is easily cleanable because of the water resistant material and the design is super convenient! It may look like a small bag but can carry a lot of water and a deceivingly large amount of other things. This is my first osprey bag but I will definitely buy from them again if I need another travel bag in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: We shall see how it does...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good pack so far...bought it for a trip to Alaska. Side pockets are stupid. Like the other reviews commented...the foam panel in the back is removable if you don’t want the form fitting back thing for the bladder. It drove me nuts. Doesn’t hold much...you basically pay for the brand. But material is nice. Sturdy. Comfortable. Even has a whistle on the chest buckle. Just found that while sitting in the airport! For $36 I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected new bag, got a used bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking forward to this backpack arriving all week, only to find that a used backpack came in that had already been taken on a trip by somebody else, all the logos are fading and there is normal wear and tear on the bag already. Very disappointed. A 50 dollar used bag with normal 20 dollar bag features. I had bought the Farpoint 40 as well, and that came in brand new and nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with design of straps
customer_reviews.text: I love Osprey but this backpack did not get 5 stars. Small fit resembles a child pack. The front throat clip made the receiver subconscious about choking. The straps were cheap
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pack! Lightweight, and sized to contain everything needed for day hikes. Side pockets easily hold my 26 oz. Kleen Kanteen water bottle. Pack is sturdy and designed to keep my back from getting sweaty on warm days. I thought I would remove the waist strap but fi d it and the chest strap very comfortable for me (5'5", 125 lbs). Well made. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Shore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent day pack and worth considering
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife before we realized that it wasn’t specifically for women. The pack has a strap on the top that initially she found uncomfortable but after adjustment in actual usage, she was happy with it. It’s a day pack so not very large but suited for that purpose. Definitely worth considering as a great pack.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pack..but its SMALL.
customer_reviews.text: Like all Osprey this is a great quality pack so I won't get into all the pluses on that end, there are numerous reviews stating this. I will say this thing is small though. Look carefully at the size and measure it compared to your existing packs. I'm a bigger guy and it looked like I was wearing my grandsons kindergarten pack :) But hey...I'm not gonna ding it any stars for that, I should have researched more first.
customer_reviews.author: Crookedsky

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for running home from work
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack to run home (approx 3 miles) from work. It is lightweight and comfortable, even with my wallet and work clothes in it. I have additionally used it on weekends when I run to grocery stores, so I can bring my grocery store bag and be eco friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a great pack pack!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great pack pack! I always read the negative reviews first, especially when a product has a vast majority of positive reviews. I thought the negative reviews on this product were a bit quibbling, although it’s good to get everybody’s perspective. One thing I would say is that the water bottle pockets could be a little deeper, but I have found that an almost all the bags have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Breck Seiniger

customer_reviews.title: It holds everything I need for work and so much better than carrying a large purse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an upcoming trip but now use it daily. It holds everything I need for work and so much better than carrying a large purse. I think it may be a little small for my intentions of bringing it on a trip. But I am using it more as an everyday bag. Well worth the cost. UPDATE: This continues to get 5 stars from me. I took it as a day bag on a two week trip and packed it. With my large camera it did fill quickly but had room for snacks.
customer_reviews.author: TMCW

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive
customer_reviews.text: This pack has so much potential but ot completely lacks comfort. The "handle" attached to the straps sits awkwardly on your c spine no matter how loose or tight you wear the pack. The liter capacity is perfect for my minimalist style of hiking but the pavk is uncomfortable enough that I switched back to my Escapist 18L pack for day hikes. Rwal flop on Osprey's part. 6'2 170lbs for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Great tote bag if you never open it
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bag for a trip to disney, overall was great for carrying around day to day items. Surprising amount of room for a bag that folds down so small. Biggest complaint was the zippers, they were more difficult to open than I would’ve liked and frequently got stuck on the liner that goes over the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My favorite day pack
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is the most perfect backpack I’ve yet to find for throwing in a combination of food, water, a light jacket, random piece of equipment and if pressed a 14” laptop. It is compact, lightweight, strong, comfortable, offers decent air circulation on your back, and forces you to take only what you really need without being too restrictive. I’ve gone a couple years and continents without any sign of wear. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kodama

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pack! It’s perfect for riding my bike to school. I fit my latptop, planner, notebook and a few other small things perfectly. I was worried it would be too small but the only things that don’t fit are my big textbooks which is fine because I can put them in my basket.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Jean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold much
customer_reviews.text: I love the Osprey brand and this back pack is of excellent quality but it can’t hold hardly anything. Seriously my size 8 women’s sneakers is about all that fits in the main part. Then the front half pocket is very annoying if you put anything in it the pack is all uneven.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed light daypack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this before a two week trip with mixed city and hiking aspects. Bag works really well as computer and accessory bag for airline travel. With hiking, using it as a day pack it works well. Over about 15 lbs it is not so comfortable as straps start to cut into shoulders
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Stays flat against my back and doesn't bounce when I jog. Other bags this pricerange will slap against my back, this stays snug and comfy. I don't use the bladder, just to carry water bottles, snacks, dog supplies and my grand trunk hammock. So capacity is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Battista

customer_reviews.title: design issue
customer_reviews.text: The piece that goes from strap to strap at the very top of the pack is too close to the neck and digs in a little. I think if you have a full pack, it might not. But when just putting a few things in for a short hike, it wouldn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: A F

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This bag is waaayyy too small. I was using it as a bag while on vacation in Hawaii. The water slots on the side won’t hold large bottles. My liter bottles kept falling out. There weren’t enough pockets in the bag. It was too small to hold a change of clothes and shoes. Wish I bought something larger for sure.
customer_reviews.author: SarahJoy

customer_reviews.title: My new edc pack/diaper bag
customer_reviews.text: This is my current edc bag. It is on the smaller side for my stature but I have a wide back so I cant blame the pack. I like this pack alot. I switched from the maxpedition wolfspur to this one. It doesn't really have to many organizational pockets in the admin pocket and they are a bit too big for my application but it will is a good size and can hold a bladder. Its VERY light and I like the generous water bottle pockets on the sides. Grab handle feels nice. It does have a sternum strap but I dont really use it. Excellent back pack for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: michael Santana

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Well built and attractive. It is much smaller than I was expecting, and it is really silly how small it is on me. Holds very little. Not great for traveling as a carry on as it’s too small a single sweatshirt takes up the entire space. As a hydration pack for a day hike, with just some snacks, first aid kit, and the water bladder it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: gone fishing 5478

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This bag holds a water bladder but also has one large pocket in the back and one smaller on in front. It was perfect for my recent backpacking trip when we did our day hikes. I loved the color options and this yellow with blue lining was cute and I felt like I was visible in the woods. I can see it being perfect for a carry on bag when traveling, as well. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: m.i.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and well designed.
customer_reviews.text: This pack is very lightweight and extremely well made. It doesn't hold a lot, so not heavy when packed either. Shoulder straps are really comfortable, even though I'm only 5 foot 2, the adjustment is perfect. Only a few pockets so it's easy to find things.
customer_reviews.author: paulalackawanna

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit right
customer_reviews.text: Osprey, I am surprised! This is so uncomfortable. The straps have an extra bizarre strap holding them together that then rubs high on your neck - you can even see it in the photo. Besides being crazy hot, it just rubs across your neck and is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the day
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack because it's small and comfortable to wear. I use this when I go to Fiesta Tx six flags or a day out in the city. It hold a good amount of stuff I only carry essentials. Maybe a bottle water and packable windbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, No Hassle Returns
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, attractive, well padded. Everything you would expect from Osprey whom I’ve purchased from many times. This was too small for what I wanted to carry. Osprey has easy no hassle returns. I will purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Osprey
customer_reviews.text: Another great Osprey product. Carried my first one across Italy 12 years ago and it's still going strong. This new one is smaller, to use as a day pack. Construction is as good as the old one. Would highly recommend Osprey products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for a day hiking trip but ended up returning it just because I didn’t like the way it felt when I had it on my back. It was a very nice backpack though and was very well made. Osprey is a great brand so I wish it would have worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S.

customer_reviews.title: outside pocket very bad spot
customer_reviews.text: The pack its self is well built. But what I really really dislike is that the outside pocket is on the top of the bag. so if you do not have very many lager items in the big pouch and you put smaller heaver items like "Keys wallet , cell phone" in the pocket on the top outside it always wants to spill out your objects.. very very annoying. My suggestion is simple putting the outside pocket on the bottom of the bag. probably going to be looking for another day pack just for that one reason. Otherwise great back pack
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Day Pack
customer_reviews.text: Fits very comfortable with a surprising amount of space (13 liters). A good simple day pack. One caution, one reason I started hiking was to lose weight. I have a 36” waist and I can’t close the waist band comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Shockwave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hiking pack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. It is a great size for hikes and it can be used for other activities. Keeps my back relatively dry on hikes. I think it’s easy to carry and fits me well. I wish the front small pocket was larger though..
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Economical Osprey
customer_reviews.text: Good little day pack. It's water reservoir ready and has mesh water bottle pockets on each side. Pack has a decent size main pocket, and a smaller pocket that perfect for your phone, wallet, and keys. The materials are uncharacteristically low quality for Osprey, but for the price it makes sense. Despite this, the pack is thoughtful, light, and reasonably comfortable. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: B. Carrasquillo

customer_reviews.title: Great day pack
customer_reviews.text: I take this thing everywhere. Work, hiking, camping, motorcycling, and vacations. Recently used it on a trip to Hawaii and it was perfect. Held all of the essentials with ease and was comfortable to wear all day. Very lightweight and the padding is good (as long as you don't overweight it). Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Osprey never lets me down
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with Osprey, the quality is unbeatable. I LOVE this backpack. It is smaller than a standard backpack, which is what I was looking for. I wanted a light pack to take hiking, and I also use it as a small diaper bag when the over-the-shoulder monster is too cumbersome. It is comfortable, lightweight, super sturdy, and the stone grey is suprisingly attractive. Love everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: slcroro

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable pack for day trips.
customer_reviews.text: Is serving me very well for day hikes with a 3-liter Camelback in the hydration pouch. My only complaints, revolve around the front (i.e. away from the wearer) pocket. If you have much in it, it bulges into the main compartment, making items in the latter difficult to access. Unless you open the zipper wide, in which case the whole front of the bag tends to flop down, making it a bit harder to close again. However, I like the size of this pack for all-day trips, it's very light, and I find it comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Callum Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Compact and efficient, quality build
customer_reviews.text: Bought this backpack for my girlfriend as a Christmas present. We do a lot of hiking and she also needed something convenient for her job, she is constantly driving and always on the go but hates carrying purses. The bag seems great, but she's hesitant to use it daily because she doesn't want to get it dirty or torn up - eventually she'll learn that Osprey bags are made for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanCorgi

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, but odd colors
customer_reviews.text: Have an older version of this pack and love the size for traveling and day hikes. As it has worn out, I looked to replace it with it’s updated model. Good design changes, but very odd colors that don’t match what shows on the web. Sadly, have returned two.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Daypack
customer_reviews.text: I would use this for everything from exploring mountains to running cities. Perfect size for a average sized girl that doesnt want a bulky bag weighing her down. The various compartments are useful. Quality is great. Also the color is beautiful I got the royal blue.
customer_reviews.author: Cnoufal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: Great for a day hike if you just need to carry some snacks, water bottle, dog stuff, and possibly a sweatshirt. Not really something you could use for more than a day hike though. Was exactly what I needed and expected. Comfortable and didn't hurt my back!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Merk

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling and hiking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a daypack for sight seeing in England and Scotland, as well as small day hikes. Works great for both, fits a Nalgene, guidebook, snacks, and a coat. Although it sits in a totally different place than I am used to (I'm used to Osprey Women's 32L and larger bags), it is surprisingly comfortable. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great Daypack or Emergency Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Another great backpack from Osprey. The Daylite is very lightweight without skimping on features. Great daypack or emergency bag while travelling. Plenty of interior gear and goodie storage for everything you would need. It's hard to find a pack at this price/size that also has a hip belt and that was a great bonus offering additional comfort and security. Prime shipping was the icing.
customer_reviews.author: WiscoSkip

customer_reviews.title: cool bag for day hikes aor every day use
customer_reviews.text: i like it i use it as an everyday carry for things like food and rain coat. The extra straps keep it secure enough it feels sturdy and just big enough so that i dont have to worry about space management. only thing i will say is the stone grey seems more like a light turquoise then grey but that is just my opinion
customer_reviews.author: auriel fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great Weekend Travel Bag
customer_reviews.text: Used the bag as a personal item on a flight avoiding the carry-on charge. Was able to carry everything needed for the weekend trip to NY. It was light, strong enough to cram lots in it and everything stayed dry during our rainy walks outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pack for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: Great pack but on the small side. It fits a 2L water reservoir but a 3L is a stretch. With a full water bag, it can still hold the essentials (sunscreen, extra layer, and lunch). Bottles fall out of the bottle holders on the sides. I'm able to attach it to the outside of my 50L backpacking bag for day trips.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack, especially for vehicle emergency
customer_reviews.text: we have two. i bought the second because my fiancé stole the first one! great little pack, and comfy to wear. she's tiny and it fits her great. i'm huge and its still totally useable (mine is used for emergency bag in the vehicle).
customer_reviews.author: Miner

customer_reviews.title: Osprey backpacks are so awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little backpack. Beautiful color, excellent quality. It was a gift for my son who just needed it to carry his things to and from work. He loves it!! This is my third Osprey backpack, in three sizes. Couldn’t be happier with them.
customer_reviews.author: Beach lover

customer_reviews.title: Great Daypack
customer_reviews.text: Fits a surprising amount of items, pretty comfortable. Also fits well as an airplane carry-on. Used on several European trips, always comfortable. Straps could be a little more padded.
customer_reviews.author: E. Debris

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have minor back issues like me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taken it on a couple day hikes now and really like it. Fits everything I could need and is comfortable on my back. I have some minor scoliosis and my back doesn’t bother me to much. This pack helps me get out there and do what I love.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee

customer_reviews.title: nice little pack for dayhikes of whatever
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made . upper strap gets in the way of zipper but probably no way around it. Minimalist rig that will fit a camera, sweatshirt, small lunch and water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lee in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Good pack!
customer_reviews.text: This pack kills my back. No matter how high or low I adjust it, my back aches after walking for more than a mile. The top handle digs into the back of my neck and it just doesn't fit right for a smaller person. A literal pain to carry around. The water bottle pockets are also pretty useless as the bottle falls out.
customer_reviews.author: Carlie Barr

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Had the older model for years and it is still great. I have traveled with the old one for 5+ years and it is wonderful. Bought a 2nd one for my wife to use. She loves it. Small enough for her (only 5 foot tall) and still holds enough for a day trip for 2.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Osprey Daylite Daypack
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed having this Osprey Daylite Daypack on my trip to Zion. It was very light and easy to adjust so that you felt like there was nothing on your back. Some of my friends had the camelback in their Osprey pack which is really convenient. Only thing they said was the camelback is hard to clean. I had to open my pack to get water out my water because the water bottle holder on the outside of the pack was too small to hold a water bottle. I would definitely recommend this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Witkin

customer_reviews.title: Best daypack I've had
customer_reviews.text: I love my daypack! This color hides dirt well. It is just big enough for a long day of hiking and light weight. Lots of pouches to separate everything you need. Very water resistant and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J Mihalik

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for..
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic daypack - not big and bulky and yet has so much capacity. I really like the zipper pulls and the shoulder padding feels great. Perfect bag for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a day hike
customer_reviews.text: Very light. Perfect for a day hike. I took it on a 7.5 hike this weekend around Fontana Dam (AT). It was so comfortable. The best feature I think is the fact that the water bladder pouch is accessible from outside the pack. It's behind the big zipper section of the pack...so you don't have to worry about taking all your other items out of the pack to refill the bladder! I also love that I can attach it to the larger Osprey packs if I decide to level up my hiking in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy S.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I like how small and compact it is. I can fit two 64 oz hydroflask inside and it doesn't feel heavy. I use the waist straps which is suppose to help alleviate some of the weight. Good for a day trip.
customer_reviews.author: dlan

customer_reviews.title: This would be 5 stars but Osprey please make the bottle mesh a few inches higher.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for its purpose. Stayed straight on my back the whole hike even climbing rocks. The back panel venting works great. The zippers are great. The water bottle mesh is a fail. It needs to be a few inches higher. When I take the pack off my water bottle falls out. Tried a nalgene and normal recycle friendly bottles and only tiny bottles stay in. I’ll find some material to sew onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Trashbag

customer_reviews.title: A great small daypack for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack to walk back and forth to work and it is perfect. It holds my work shoes, lunch in the big pocket and smaller items like ID badge and keys in the smaller pocket. Well designed except for the side water bottle pockets, mentioned in other reviews. This has not been a problem for me. The small size is perfect for me: a medium size woman. I particularly like: the color, the round tabs on zipper pulls, the fit. A steal for $29
customer_reviews.author: woodlandrowergirl

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and big enough to carry what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great day pack for hiking. Easy to fit everything I needed for a hike and light too. 10 hours of carrying it and no problems with back or shoulder pain. Held up to some rough terrain of trees, branches, sharp lava rock, and sliding down snow/ice. Held 2 liters of water and could probably hold a 3 liter bag as well. Would definitely buy again and/or other products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Tina B.

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable lightweight pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this daypack for day hikes in the Canadian Rockies. It was super comfortable and the chest and waist straps were a nice feature. Fit my 2L hydration pack perfectly. The extra clips (which appear to be designed to clip this bag to a larger bag) were useful extra straps for clipping other things to the pack. The rigid foam back insert was a nice feature on a bag this size. No complaints at all!
customer_reviews.author: justin_vt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walking backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it for nature walks. Only Con is my water bottle doesn't stay in the side pockets so I have to put it in the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I really like this backpack, it is perfect for day hiking. I can fit everything I need for up to a 12 mile hike in this (potentially more, 12 miles is the most I have done so far). It is compact and I find it very useful. The bands don't cut into my shoulders like my old backpack did, so its a win for me.
customer_reviews.author: NinjaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Super and super
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I bought it for hiking trip through the Amalfi Coast. It worked perfect. I now use it for my daily work bag. It's too small for my 15 inch laptop but great for my Surface Pro. Very durable and does not have the bulk of my previous work bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner6626

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model of this pack,it is made of better fabric,but hey it’s all about the bottom line,right? So for fifty bucks It what you get
customer_reviews.author: Dust off

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Only ways I could think to improve it would be if the clasp across the chest was a little lower and if it had a net back instead of foam with holes. Otherwise it's light, tough, and has great design of pockets and straps. The side pocket and strap is able to fit my full-sized camera tripod.
customer_reviews.author: chipFive

customer_reviews.title: Good size, handy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy but the straps could use a little more padding. Works for what I need it to do and holds a good bit for such a small form factor. I love that it attaches to other packs, makes it even more handy for traveling
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

product_meta.title: Osprey Daylite Daypack
product_meta.description: The Daylite Series started out with humble beginnings, a simple accessory to attach to our larger packs. However, its lightweight, simplicity, durability, comfortable carry and price has proven to be wildly popular, and today their popularity is undeniable. While the Daylite and Daylite Plus continue to serve well as add-on packs for traveling and more, they shine on their own with incredible versatility and are now available in an even more robust color palette than before. Waist: Adjustable 1.5 inches webbing hipbelt. No matter where you go, the Daylite series is backed by Osprey's All Mighty Guarantee.
feature_bullets: Large panel loading main compartment provides accessibility to inside contents
Dual stretch mesh side pockets provide additional storage options
The multi-function interior sleeve can be used for either a hydration reservoir or tablet
Mesh-covered die-cut foam back panel provides both comfort and ventilation.
Front zippered pocket with mesh organizer and key clip
Total volume: 13L - Attaches to a variety of compatible Osprey Packs

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
